name: Pongal
description: Makar Sankranti is a harvest festival celebrated with the flying of colorful kites, preparation of sweets like 'tilgul,' and exchanging of gifts.

name: Lohri
description: Lohri is celebrated with bonfires, folk songs, and dance in North India, particularly in Punjab.

name: Maha Shivaratri
description: Maha Shivaratri is a Hindu festival dedicated to Lord Shiva. Devotees fast and offer prayers to Lord Shiva on this day.

name: Vasant Panchami
description: Vasant Panchami marks the arrival of spring and is dedicated to the worship of Goddess Saraswati, the deity of knowledge, music, and art.

name: Losar
description: Losar is the Tibetan New Year celebrated with traditional ceremonies and cultural performances by Tibetan communities in India.

name: Holi
famous_place: Mathura, Vrindavan, Barsana, and other cities across India
description: Holi is the festival of colors. People play with colored powders and water, and it signifies the victory of good over evil.

name: Maha Shivaratri
description: Maha Shivaratri is a Hindu festival dedicated to Lord Shiva. Devotees fast and offer prayers to Lord Shiva on this day.

name: Dol Purnima
description: Dol Purnima is celebrated with joy and enthusiasm in West Bengal, where processions with idols of Lord Krishna and Radha are taken out.

name: Baisakhi (Vaisakhi)
description: Baisakhi is a Sikh and Hindu festival that marks the harvest of crops. It is celebrated with vibrant processions and dance.

name: Vishu
description: Vishu is the Malayalam New Year and is celebrated with the Vishu Kani arrangement, traditional feasts, and cultural performances.

name: Gudi Padwa
description: Gudi Padwa marks the Marathi New Year and is celebrated with the raising of the Gudi flag and traditional festivities.

name: Buddha Purnima
description: Buddha Purnima celebrates the birth, enlightenment, and death of Gautama Buddha. It is observed with prayer and meditation.

name: Ganga Dussehra
description: Ganga Dussehra is dedicated to Goddess Ganga and celebrates the descent of the Ganges River to Earth. Devotees take a holy dip in the river.

name: Hemis Festival
description: Hemis Festival is a major Buddhist festival celebrated with masked dances and cultural performances at Hemis Monastery.

name: Vat Savitri Vrat
description: Vat Savitri Vrat is observed by married Hindu women for the well-being and long life of their husbands. They tie threads around banyan trees.

name: Chandan Yatra
description: Chandan Yatra is a 42-day-long festival where the deities of Lord Jagannath, Balabhadra, and Subhadra are taken on a boat ride.

name: Rath Yatra
description: Rath Yatra is a grand chariot festival dedicated to Lord Jagannath, Lord Balabhadra, and Devi Subhadra. The deities are taken on chariots.

name: Ambubachi Mela
description: Ambubachi Mela is a Hindu festival celebrated at the Kamakhya Temple. It marks the annual menstruation of the Goddess Kamakhya.

name: Hemis Tsechu
description: Hemis Tsechu is a Buddhist festival celebrated with masked dances, rituals, and cultural performances at Hemis Monastery.

name: Raja Parba
description: Raja Parba is a three-day festival celebrating womanhood, fertility, and the onset of the monsoon in Odisha.

name: Guru Purnima
description: Guru Purnima is a day to honor and express gratitude to spiritual and academic teachers. It is observed by Buddhists, Hindus, and Jains.

name: Bonalu
description: Bonalu is a Hindu festival celebrated in Telangana to honor the Goddess Mahakali. Devotees offer food and rituals to the deity.

name: Ashadi Ekadashi
description: Ashadi Ekadashi is a significant festival dedicated to Lord Vithoba in Pandharpur, Maharashtra. Pilgrims visit the temple.

name: Raksha Bandhan
description: Raksha Bandhan is a Hindu festival celebrating the bond between brothers and sisters. Sisters tie rakhi on their brothers' wrists.

name: Krishna Janmashtami
description: Krishna Janmashtami is the birth anniversary of Lord Krishna. Devotees fast, sing bhajans, and enact Krishna's life stories.

name: Onam
description: Onam is the harvest festival of Kerala. It is celebrated with grand feasts, traditional dance (Kathakali), and boat races.

name: Ganesh Chaturthi
description: Ganesh Chaturthi is dedicated to Lord Ganesha. It involves the installation of Ganesha idols, prayers, and cultural events.

name: Rosh Hashanah
description: Rosh Hashanah is the Jewish New Year. It is celebrated with synagogue services, festive meals, and the blowing of the shofar.

name: Navratri
description: Navratri is a Hindu festival celebrating the goddess Durga. It involves nine nights of dance, music, and religious rituals.

name: Bakrid (Eid al-Adha)
description: Bakrid, also known as Eid al-Adha, is an Islamic festival of sacrifice. It involves prayers, feasts, and the sacrifice of animals.

name: Dussehra (Vijayadashami)
description: Dussehra, also known as Vijayadashami, marks the victory of good over evil. It includes the burning of effigies and Ram Leela performances.

name: Diwali
description: Diwali, the Festival of Lights, is celebrated with lamps, fireworks, sweets, and prayers to the goddess Lakshmi.

name: Guru Nanak Jayanti
description: Guru Nanak Jayanti commemorates the birth of Guru Nanak, the founder of Sikhism. It involves religious processions and prayers.

name: Karva Chauth
description: Karva Chauth is a fasting ritual observed by married Hindu women for the well-being and longevity of their husbands.

name: Chhath Puja
description: Chhath Puja is an ancient Hindu festival dedicated to the sun god. It involves rigorous rituals and offerings to the sun.

name: Kartik Purnima
description: Kartik Purnima is a Hindu festival celebrated with bathing in the Ganges and lighting lamps on the riverbanks.

name: Christmas
description: Christmas is a Christian festival celebrating the birth of Jesus Christ. It is widely observed with decorations, carols, and gift-giving.

name: Bhogali Bihu
description: Bhogali Bihu, also known as Magh Bihu, is an Assamese harvest festival celebrated with feasts and traditional games.

name: Sikkim Winter Carnival
description: The Sikkim Winter Carnival is a colorful festival featuring cultural performances, food, and winter sports in Gangtok.

name: Festival of the Sun God
description: The Festival of the Sun God, or Magha Saptami, is celebrated with rituals and a holy dip in rivers to honor the sun god.
